data.text:
We have worked with the South Sudanese on establishing "mobile courts". And it's had a huge impact because for the first time it ends impunity. 

-- @unmissmedia head David Shearer talks to @MelissaFleming about his work on our Awake At Night podcast. https://t.co/8YweCaTib6 https://t.co/zWMeMQkJJB

34 million people are only one step away from starvation globally & acute hunger is expected to soar in 20+ countries.

@FAO & @WFP are calling for urgent funding to provide vital humanitarian aid that would help stop rising hunger & the risk of famine. https://t.co/DS2lJ3sClE https://t.co/UQ5JLOCYd5

"You are a clear example of the heroic work of women leading the response to #COVID19."

-- @antonioguterres told Scholastica Dery, a health worker in Ghana, in a conversation about her work on the frontline of the pandemic and the importance of vaccine access for everyone. https://t.co/38bj04uzAG

15% of countries & territories have no gender-sensitive measures in their #COVID19 response plans.

Women's needs must be taken into account to build a more equitable, inclusive future. 

More from @UN_Women & @UNDP: https://t.co/Iq68bOpbeR https://t.co/wRAxDVCMOV

Lights out! UNHQ in NYC went dark for Saturday's #EarthHour. 

Here's how you can take #ClimateAction all year round: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/K0SwbM12x5

#COVID19 respects no borders, which is why none of us are safe until all of us are safe.

See how the UN continues to support communities and countries around the world in their struggle against the virus in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/8CRA2VhCRk

"We need to act on the premise that every shot in every arm brings us all closer to returning to the people & the places we love."

-- @MelissaFleming shares her experience with the #COVID19 vaccine & stresses that #OnlyTogether can we end the crisis. https://t.co/XqQyipel9H

"I’m profoundly concerned about the rise of violence against Asians & people of Asian descent.

There can be no room for hatred in the future we are striving to build." 

-- @antonioguterres stressed earlier this week. https://t.co/geu6r7PpTi #StopAsianHate

Saturday's #EarthHour is a good reminder that small #ClimateAction steps can make a big difference.

Join us and turn off your lights for an hour at 8.30pm local time - wherever you are. https://t.co/UuZ1z3hQPc

"I joined the UN because I believe in the power of a global alliance to solve problems together."

-- @UN_MINUSMA's Joanna Adamson talks about her work #ServingForPeace. 

More on senior #WomenInPeacekeeping: https://t.co/EAePZexdPt https://t.co/EWBdGfbOcj

"I live to fight for justice, and that's what I will do."

Nigerian human rights lawyer Rashidat Mohammed is helping to protect vulnerable women & children who have experienced violence.

Watch her story & see how the UN is supporting her efforts. https://t.co/GkIIHvKvQ8 https://t.co/IRmyQj98sx

Women & girls represent half of the world’s population, yet, no country has achieved gender equality. 

Advancing women's empowerment is critical to achieving the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/8P3J5BnDXo https://t.co/38fmC4iI58

Only 13 countries have 50% or more women ministers & the number of countries with no women in government has increased.

See where your country stands on @UN_Women's 2021 Women in Politics map: https://t.co/b5EceiJcqd https://t.co/uPD6yWURVj

100 million more children than expected are falling behind in reading skills due to #COVID19 school closures. 

@UNESCO calls for more support for teachers & greater availability of digital learning tools.  https://t.co/g4Yapt460R

#Myanmar: Ongoing violence committed by security forces remains deeply disturbing, says UN Special Envoy @SchranerBurgen1, warning that the military's actions put the country's future at risk. https://t.co/OkxiV6eHC9

"Wherever we see racism, we must condemn it without reservation, without hesitation, without qualification.   
 
This includes looking into our own hearts and minds." -- @antonioguterres

More on how we can all #FightRacism: https://t.co/Ijz1XWpOD8 https://t.co/4HfxWt4rZS

🗓 Plan your meals
📦 Learn how to store food
🥙 Eat leftovers
❄️ Freeze excess food
🌱 Compost
More tips on how to reduce food waste from @FAO: https://t.co/cunVOH3M4c #ClimateAction

https://t.co/MtLMdRmFSB

"I can see peace. I can see that women & children are going to sleep soundly, not with guns."

-- Caroline Waudo, head of @unmissmedia field office, on one of her proudest moments working for @UNPeacekeeping.  

More on senior #WomenInPeacekeeping: https://t.co/EAePZefCXV https://t.co/B8IndGFKlR

The pandemic has impacted the availability of medicines, increased demand for drugs used to treat #COVID19 & disrupted mental health & substance abuse services. 

More in latest report from the International Narcotics Control Board. https://t.co/zWuVYMmKuj #INCB https://t.co/vFL3lH5UDb

"It becomes a vocation to help people."

-- @UNPeacekeeping's Jens Kristensen talks to @MelissaFleming about what motivated him to dedicate his life to help others. 

Listen to his story in the latest episode of our podcast 'Awake At Night': https://t.co/WWMQp4SwkG https://t.co/SwFucOG1jJ

The SDG Global Festival of Action is underway, uniting people from around the world to mobilize, inspire & connect for the #GlobalGoals.

Follow @SDGaction for all the latest and register here for the full experience. https://t.co/bdjTe8AFqB https://t.co/6eKOQd1oOC

We've all missed doing the things we love. But we have the power to end #COVID19 faster — by sharing the vaccine fairly around the world. 

#OnlyTogether can we ensure everyone is protected so we can get back to the things we love. https://t.co/lsfaV8no4k https://t.co/eul9faHqYk

Amid the dramatic economic fallout from #COVID19, new #Fin4Dev report calls for strategic & timely action to rebuild better, lift people & countries out of poverty and achieve the #GlobalGoals. 

#OnlyTogether can we recover from the crisis. https://t.co/5h1zE3HwaO https://t.co/gHLhzq0RFI

#Myanmar: @UNHumanRights independent expert calls for emergency summit on deteriorating situation in the country, warns crisis is likely to worsen without immediate, robust international response. https://t.co/E1u7XixRFb

"The transatlantic slave trade ended more than two centuries ago, but the ideas of white supremacy that underpinned it remain alive. 

We must end the legacy of this racist lie."

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's #RememberSlavery Day. https://t.co/ZYrCYhWvtN https://t.co/7neCt88eZe

"The 2010 Haiti earthquake was a terrible disaster for the UN, Haiti & the world. I think that finding me as a survivor gave people hope. It was a light in the darkness. People were cheering."

-- @UNPeacekeeping's Jens Kristensen on Awake At Night with @MelissaFleming.

Recognition
Justice
Development

On Thursday's #RememberSlavery Day, find out about the International Decade for People of #AfricanDescent: https://t.co/SyNBqTcw93 https://t.co/nXaP6dVW3X

UN staff members work in some of the most challenging & dangerous places in the world. 

On Thursday's International Day of Solidarity, we honour and stand united with our colleagues who are detained or missing. https://t.co/miwlu3Pts2 https://t.co/OmnLggSelV

Thursday's #RememberSlavery Day is an opportunity to demonstrate respect & understanding towards victims of slavery.

It also allows us to reinforce our determination to #FightRacism, which remains a legacy of one of the darkest chapters in human history. https://t.co/8MmiNyKzya https://t.co/d7oSuSBpiR

🐝 3/4 of the 🌍's food crops depend on pollinators such as bees - yet over 40% of them face extinction. 

On Wednesday, a @UNESCO forum heard that biodiversity is at risk & threatens human survival. https://t.co/iGKoNnGetJ https://t.co/HSwtRA7ebc

"Once seemingly insurmountable divisions can be overcome with determined political will and receptivity to the demands & aspirations of the Libyan people."

-- @UNJanKubis, head of @UNSMILibya, reports progress towards lasting peace in the country. https://t.co/KC43grJ0nf

The transatlantic slave trade ended centuries ago, but its shameful legacy of racism persists. 

On Thursday's #RememberSlavery Day & always, we must #FightRacism & take a stand against discrimination & inequalities. https://t.co/8MmiNyKzya https://t.co/Ww3yuLEgbC

Niger: @antonioguterres strongly condemns the second deadly attack against civilians in less than a week, and calls on the Nigerien authorities to swiftly bring the perpetrators to justice. 
https://t.co/O98mG3kjoV

"You are a clear example of the heroic work of women leading the response to #COVID19."

-- @antonioguterres told Scholastica Dery, a health worker in Ghana, in a conversation about her work on the frontline of the pandemic and the importance of vaccine access for everyone. https://t.co/gLXqyZpt0W

"We need to act on the premise that every shot in every arm brings us all closer to returning to the people & the places we love."

-- @MelissaFleming shares her experience with the #COVID19 vaccine & stresses that #OnlyTogether can we can end the crisis. https://t.co/XqQyipel9H

<2% of #COVID19 vaccines have reached Africa, though 18% of the world's population lives on the continent.

Dr. Mphaphuli explains why much more needs to be done to distribute vaccines fairly around the world.

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic. https://t.co/lsfaV8EZsU https://t.co/GcYaPjkGta

Stigmatizing people with tuberculosis inhibits care. Stand against stigma & discrimination on Wednesday's #WorldTBDay & every day. 

More from @WHO: https://t.co/Ndp5omTNzm #EndTB https://t.co/rzlEpGmeWE

On Wednesday's International Day for the Right to Truth about Human Rights Abuses, we remember the victims and pay tribute to those who have devoted their lives to #StandUp4HumanRights. https://t.co/ybGA2M5enH https://t.co/Rw31P62L7E

1 in 3 people with tuberculosis do not receive the quality care they need.

On Wednesday's #WorldTBDay, @WHO is calling attention to the persistent risks posed by this deadly respiratory illness. #HealthForAll https://t.co/Ndp5onboXW https://t.co/CvaJi55H3T

"Afghans are not just ready for peace: they are demanding it. And all sides need to stop the violence and need the violence to stop."

-- UN Special Representative Deborah Lyons briefs the Security Council on the situation in Afghanistan. https://t.co/N8xcY9mNAt

Disruptions to health services due to #COVID19 threaten hard-won gains in the fight against tuberculosis worldwide.

On Wednesday's #WorldTBDay, @WHO calls for wider testing and treatment to end preventable deaths. https://t.co/Ndp5omTNzm https://t.co/b6GPYOcJv2

Health workers have been on the frontlines of the pandemic. 
They must be first in line for the #COVID19 vaccine -- everywhere. 

Join @WHO and show your support for the equitable rollout of vaccines, starting with healthcare heroes. https://t.co/19WU7VwDb4 #VaccinEquity https://t.co/g7H2OASGhK

15 people have died, 400+ are missing & 500+ have been injured in devastating fire in Cox's Bazar refugee camp. 

UN agencies are providing critical medical support & protection for 45,000+ Rohingya refugees who lost their shelter & belongings. https://t.co/TOfOVLiWck

Tuesday's #WorldMetDay highlights the importance of the ocean as a major driver of the world's weather, climate and economy. 

More from @WMO: https://t.co/53g15db2Ln #OceanDecade https://t.co/T56w9MEuJ1

How can smartphones & apps contribute to tackling the climate emergency?
See an example of how @IFAD is using digital solutions to help farmers in Viet Nam take #ClimateAction & achieve #ZeroHunger.

 https://t.co/Jsu0bIhATt

"Only by understanding and protecting our planet can we ensure a sustainable future for humanity."

-- @antonioguterres highlights the importance of #ClimateAction on Tuesday's #WorldMetDay. https://t.co/53g15cTrmN https://t.co/oMLXz1IfUA

Women have been on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response. Yet, they have been largely excluded from decision-making processes on how to address the impacts of the pandemic.
This will perpetuate the gender divide. https://t.co/Iq68bOGMDr https://t.co/LqXYwMFFrq

1,600+ businesses 💼 
560+ universities 🎓
470+ cities 🏨 
& many more have committed to halving emissions by 2030.

Join them in the #RaceToZero - for a healthier, more inclusive & resilient zero-carbon economy. https://t.co/Cn9ETC9wAu #ClimateAction https://t.co/3Zl9bLDmby

Preserving our ocean & its resources protects our future.

On Tuesday's #WorldMetDay, find out from @UNEP what progress has been made to #BeatPlasticPollution: https://t.co/alMBBJlnWL https://t.co/F8ycvYqsfx

Water is an invaluable, but increasingly scarce, resource.

See how the UN joined people around the world in celebrating Monday's #WorldWaterDay. https://t.co/OcRu8o8C0J

"I’m profoundly concerned about the rise of violence against Asians & people of Asian descent.

There can be no room for hatred in the future we are striving to build."

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/geu6r7PpTi #StopAsianHate https://t.co/liEQVNRV38

The ocean drives climate & weather. It also absorbs around 90% of excess heat trapped by C02. 

Yet, the climate emergency has made the ocean more vulnerable & hazardous.  

More from @WMO on Tuesday's #WorldMetDay: https://t.co/53g15db2Ln
#OceanDecade

https://t.co/zSmGsClAfH

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

Yet racism is a problem in every country. 

During Racial Solidarity Week, find out more from @UNHumanRights about how we can all speak out and #FightRacism & intolerance: https://t.co/Ijz1XW8dey https://t.co/dNkKD6rNJj

"Let us commit to intensifying efforts to truly valuing water so all may have equitable access to this most precious resource."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's #WorldWaterDay. https://t.co/nuncZhFZfK https://t.co/I0vclsf8Op

Clean water & good hygiene are the strongest defence against #COVID19.

Yet, 3 billion people live without basic hand-washing facilities at home.

On #WorldWaterDay, @UNESCO has everything you need to know about this unique resource: https://t.co/rv413617sX https://t.co/X3b54MU2wS

UN teams do whatever it takes to provide life-saving aid.
Watch our UNHCR colleagues navigate difficult terrain to reach refugees who fled violence & found safety in remote areas of the Democratic Republic of the Congo. https://t.co/rgzm5LrE3n

https://t.co/zH0tGmZ1wZ

Polluted waters have negative impacts on our health, agriculture and the environment. 

On Monday's #WorldWaterDay, see how @FAO works to promote water quality and food safety amid #COVID19: https://t.co/uGF1L88JsI https://t.co/d8MFRZs9ON

History was made when @NOIweala recently became the first African and the first woman to head the @WTO.

More about her priorities & inspiring leadership in latest @africarenewal ⤵️

https://t.co/AvCKGzzkrF

As leaders & changemakers, women play a key role in shaping peace & political processes.

More about their critical contributions to @UNPeacekeeping amid #COVID19: https://t.co/bK3jtPH2TG https://t.co/17SOrimQb6

🚰 1 in 3 people live without safe drinking water.
💧 By 2025, half of the global population will be living in areas where water is scarce.

On Monday's #WorldWaterDay & every day, let's commit to protect this valuable resource! https://t.co/TblnsWsOa2 https://t.co/J8hEkwkdve

Every action #ForNature counts.

On Sunday's #IntlForestDay, learn about 5 things you can do to help forests survive and thrive. https://t.co/WaVmPIlBAH https://t.co/zaSgdxwHj2

Sunday's #WorldPoetryDay is a chance to celebrate the unique ability of poetry to capture the creative spirit of the human mind.

More from @UNESCO: https://t.co/BULJw80Dl7 https://t.co/qHMpGA9GBe

1 world. 7.5+ billion unique faces.

Diversity is a strength, not a threat.

In these difficult times - and always - we must take a stand against intolerance and discrimination. 

Sunday is #FightRacism Day. https://t.co/lf77gPECAn https://t.co/YzBaOU3ZGo

Sunday is #WorldPoetryDay!

Let's celebrate the power of poetry to illuminate the beauty that surrounds us & the resilience of the human spirit. https://t.co/BULJw8iecF https://t.co/4zTpTgLD3U

Forests provide more than 86 million green jobs and support the livelihoods of many more people.

More from @FAO on the benefits of sustainable forestry on Sunday's #IntlForestDay: https://t.co/Y0sGoJhpQO https://t.co/iLgSJ6Kut7

"When we come to it 
We must confess that we are the possible 
We are the miraculous, we are the true wonder of this world
That is when, & only when 
We come to it."

"A Brave and Startling Truth", by Maya Angelou for UN's 50th anniversary. #WorldPoetryDay https://t.co/DzCxQGniUl https://t.co/VN4q7VagOn

"Wherever we see racism, we must condemn it without reservation, without hesitation, without qualification. "

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's #FightRacism Day. https://t.co/PhqZvKfMUM https://t.co/9odHrJ1IMW

People with Down syndrome must be able to meaningfully participate in decision-making on issues affecting their lives, including during this time of global crisis. 

More on Sunday's World Down Syndrome Day: https://t.co/GrH2Oli4Kd https://t.co/AmYbUNH1au

75% of all emerging infectious diseases are caused by germs moving from animals to humans.

Planting & restoring forests helps build the planet's natural defenses against diseases. 

Sunday is #IntlForestDay. https://t.co/ZzxCE5VuKn via @UNDESA https://t.co/G68O2QLRw7

Poems can provide comfort & inspiration in times of crisis and difficulty.

On Sunday's #WorldPoetryDay, share a poem that has helped you during a difficult time. https://t.co/DzCxQGniUl https://t.co/oakfBRmrwV

On Sunday's #FightRacism Day, we celebrate the young human rights defenders who, through their global engagement for equality & inclusion, build solidarity, lead change and stand up against racism. 

More from @UNHumanRights: https://t.co/rUmbZH7FDz https://t.co/kDUw6USXfG

"The 2010 Haiti earthquake was a terrible disaster for the UN, Haiti & the world. I think that finding me as a survivor gave people hope. It was a light in the darkness. People were cheering."

-- @UNPeacekeeping's Jens Kristensen on Awake At Night with @MelissaFleming.

Talking about the climate crisis can be challenging. But it’s important. 

Everyone has a role to play in taking #ClimateAction & protecting our planet. 

Follow us on @tiktok_us & get inspired to #ActNow. https://t.co/bMDz2BLLHO https://t.co/Wibs1zLw5m

Prioritizing mental health is important during times of high stress such as #COVID19.

Find moments of happiness by relaxing, practicing mindfulness and connecting with friends & family.

On Saturday's #HappinessDay, get wellness resources here: https://t.co/O1IYPOvv0A… https://t.co/LyFiOmkYWA

#COVID19 has created a global mental health crisis.

On Saturday's #HappinessDay, see 4 tips for your mental health and ideas on how to help others who may need some extra support during the pandemic. More from @WHO: https://t.co/kDphI8M633 https://t.co/g22TeUxAgA

"Together, we have a chance to leave behind entrenched exclusion, and build a just and equal future."

-- @antonioguterres at the opening of the Commission on the Status of Women this week. https://t.co/zAiAL0o7l7 #CSW65 https://t.co/U6grzu64Z0

300 million people speak French around the world.

On Friday's French Language Day, and every day, follow @ONU_fr to get updates on the #COVID19 pandemic & more ... en français.

https://t.co/FgmoPtstYh

Kindness & compassion can help promote happiness and build a better world for all. 

More on Saturday's #HappinessDay: https://t.co/Vn0cc7GwCO https://t.co/meXFSjVdvS

"Wherever we see racism, we must condemn it without reservation, without hesitation, without qualification.   
 
This includes looking into our own hearts and minds." 

-- @antonioguterres https://t.co/xbFmuVsq7h https://t.co/n81xSCy42K

"Ending & preventing sexual exploitation and abuse by UN personnel is a top priority for me." 

@antonioguterres releases annual update on work to stamp out the scourge of sexual exploitation & abuse through zero-tolerance policy. https://t.co/3iDPe4zlV7

Myanmar: Further escalation of crisis, including occupation of 60+ schools by security forces, condemned by UN. 

@antonioguterres says killing of peaceful demonstrators & arbitrary arrests, including of journalists, is unacceptable. https://t.co/nDJLVKit46

"To end racial injustice in law enforcement, we cannot simply see the tip of the iceberg - we must face the mass below the surface."

– @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet on addressing human rights violations committed by law enforcement. https://t.co/2uBD1Gj4Ry #FightRacism https://t.co/Xc8AU4ZXGI

Every year, #Nowruz is celebrated as a day of hope & renewal.

At a time of global anxiety as countries around the world are addressing the #COVID19 pandemic, our thoughts & solidarity are with all those marking Nowruz. https://t.co/5XHXxJzHfa https://t.co/bhG8JkiQpa

Young people will face the consequences of the climate crisis in the most dramatic way. 

As agents of change, they are key to taking #ClimateAction. 
https://t.co/1wOuls9k9f

Myanmar: @UNHumanRights independent experts raise alarm over escalation of human rights violations, warning that response to pro-democracy protests is getting increasingly violent. https://t.co/k82DaeQbAM

Many people have negative beliefs about others based on their age, resulting in poorer physical & mental health and reduced quality of life for older persons.

These types of ageist attitudes also cost societies billions of dollars each year, warns @WHO. https://t.co/o4qtOfh5um https://t.co/jIPMjP5PGZ

"It is a moral failure that we live in a world with such high levels of technical innovation & success, but we continue to allow billions of people to exist without clean drinking water or the basic tools to wash their hands." 
-- @UN_PGA #EveryDrop    
https://t.co/GsfSLixRbQ

New projections show stronger than expected economic growth in 2021.

But @UNCTAD warns that unresolved challenges related to inequality, indebtedness & weak investment threaten hopes for a more resilient future & achievement of the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/Nra5MSQL1d https://t.co/3FVOkTIh85

The 2.5 billion people working in agriculture worldwide face grave risks due to natural disasters that destroy food, and devastate lives & livelihoods.

More facts about the impact of disasters on agriculture in latest @FAO report: https://t.co/mn9vYi4ZdN https://t.co/jHZv0TtOG9

Climate conditions, including the onset of northern hemisphere spring, should not be used as trigger to relax #COVID19 control measures, @WMO says.

Stay safe by wearing a mask, keeping physical distance & washing your hands. https://t.co/oDI8syYimi

https://t.co/GVTTYLQVDL

Yemen: The UN and its partners seek $3.85 billion for humanitarian response in the country. 

Plan aims to reach nearly 80% of the population amid worsening crisis. https://t.co/qoBRmAC33j

1 in 4 young women will have already experienced violence by an intimate partner by the time they reach their mid-20s.

@WHO study warns that #COVID19 has further increased women's exposure to violence. https://t.co/S2xluanSci https://t.co/n66428usrb

Everyone has the right to life, liberty & security of person.

Around the world, UNHCR works to save lives, protect rights & build a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities & stateless people. https://t.co/mPALqfhGMo via @Refugees https://t.co/50jkjydLNy

Over the last decade, millions of Syrians - including our colleague Rania - have seen the country they love change forever.
 
Now, Raina shares her story, and explains how living through conflict inspired her to join @WFP to help others. https://t.co/KrcOBxBjRH

Hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia have been on the rise as a result of #COVID19.

We must work together to #StandUp4HumanRights and 𝐒𝐓𝐎𝐏 all forms of racism, discrimination & hatred. https://t.co/siDRqxkzEm https://t.co/AfIA6pbVL6

#OnlyTogether can we end the pandemic by ensuring people around the world can get a vaccine.

Get inspired by these acts of unity & solidarity amid #COVID19 in our latest @TwitterMoments: 
https://t.co/65syhq81wG

Disruptions to health services due to #COVID19 have led to a sharp increase in child & maternal deaths in South Asia. 

Access to these essential services must be urgently restored with all possible safety measures.
https://t.co/vP6lrRfeny

"When it comes to a pandemic, it really needs global collaboration and solidarity." 

-- @WHO's @DoctorSoumya talks to @MelissaFleming about how #OnlyTogether we can end the #COVID19 crisis in the latest episode of our Awake At Night podcast: https://t.co/GS6CFWizMK https://t.co/looybEjxBL
